archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle: Papers of Maud Carter Clement 1756-1968
did.physdesc: This collection consists of ca. 2000 items.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of Maud Carter Clement, Accession #9479, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was a gift of Rutledge C. Clement and Henry T. Clement of Danville, Va. and Chatham, Va., 1970 May 8.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Boxes were not re-numbered when six boxes of official records of the Pittsylvania County Court were transferred to the Library of Virginia in October, 1975. Thus, there is a gap in numbering between boxes 2 and 9.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Maud Carter Clement was a writer and historian of southwestern Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Genealogical information and local history of Pittsylvania County, Va. are the main interests of the collection of Mrs. Clement, a southwest Virginia historian and writer. Correspondence, articles, speeches, garden club material, and memorabilia are also included. The collection contains surveyors maps of southwest Virginia and an extract of a 1795 diary of Marsha D. Blodgett.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Six boxes of official records of the Pittsylvania County Court (originally boxes 3-8) were transferred to the Library of Virginia in October, 1975.
